title: Album Page, "Sketches from Buhl", May 23, 1888
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 37; lower right corner, 32; below right of drawing: Steeple at / Buhl / 23rd May 1888 / A walk I took from Baden Baden.
description: Vertical sheet depicting four sketches of buildings or architectural elements.  The upper half of the sheet has two views of a half-timbered building.  The left drawing shows the building with a masonry first story and half-timber and plaster above.  At right, possibly the same building from the rear. Below is another half-timbered building seen from a three-quarter view.  It has timbering that alternates between straight timbers and those have been carved into an S-shape.  Above is a deep overhang and steep tiled roof.  At right is the steeple of a bell tower, consisting of  a trio of graduated onion domes, and a small finial.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches from Buhl", May 23, 1888.Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-205.
